Moderna releases a press release outlining that their #COVID19 vaccine is safe & has excellent efficacy in their study of 3,700 participants between 12-18 years of age.

This will likely join Pfizer as the 2nd vaccine approved for this age group.

Link: https://t.co/nl2zZn3E7c https://t.co/HYOVHaiggQ

Looking at the comments, it appears that some may think that the data above is an excuse to be more permissive of #COVID19 in children, which is of course unacceptable.

Regardless of the rates of chronic symptoms, we have to create safe indoor environments for kids (eg schools).
Regardless, chronic post-COVID19 symptoms are a growing problem requiring more resources to further understand & manage for all age groups.
Helpful thread outlining the low prevalence of chronic #COVID19 symptoms in children, with links to data üëá https://t.co/I0Iv6AROQp

-Variant initially discovered in India (B.1.617) spreading
-AstraZeneca & Pfizer are effective, even against B.1.617 
-2 doses provide greater protection

This is a very respectable number for a Saturday.

183,399 #COVID19 vaccines were administered in Ontario, as of 8pm today.

You read that right...>183K, the most vaccines administered in the province in a single day. By far.

Happy Victoria Day long weekend everyone.

(Darting Raven, by Kenojuak Ashevak, h/t @CanadaPaintings) https://t.co/UZVzUgaJF7

Nuance & data in #COVID19 transmission dynamics? For real?

Well it's all here. 

Public Health Ontario has it covered...

Link: https://t.co/ui0rawv5x9 https://t.co/cNQRf95ddQ

2nd doses of AstraZeneca's #COVID19 vaccine will be offered in Ontario, starting with those who received a 1st dose in March (10-12 weeks after 1st).

No AZ vaccine should expire.

Risk of blood clotting (VITT) is quoted as 1:600,000 for 2nd doses, as per press conference today.

Best summary of evidence to date outlining how #COVID19 vaccines provide indirect protection to close contacts, even if a vaccinated person is infected, "by reducing the duration or degree of infectiousness."

https://t.co/Cq9n5QB0G6 by @mugecevik @AaronRichterman @EricMeyerowitz https://t.co/ytnx8TGF6W

152,998 #COVID19 vaccines have been administered so far today in Ontario as of 8pm. 

That's a huge day. Thank you to the thousands of people making this happen. 

(Illustration by Sheldon Cohen, from Roch Carrier's 'The Hockey Sweater') https://t.co/IZVzb2fz6n

Also, Minister @celliottability discussed that the % vaccination is important (we are already nearing 60%) but they are also paying attention to hospital capacity and community burden of #COVID19. Smart.

Also, some promising evidence of vaccine equity in action. 

There is high uptake of #COVID19 vaccines in highly-impacted communities, largely due to: 

1) Priority allocation

2) Meaningful local outreach & community engagement by public health and community-based organizations https://t.co/cVUmPltNpf

Steady positive progress in Ontario on the #COVID19 front- fewer daily cases, slowly decompressing hospitals & a greater pace of vaccination.

Let's hope the pace of re-opening is proportionately aligned to the slow (but real) improvements.

https://t.co/b3Z8A4tnJn by @tvo staff. https://t.co/JduvSac2Zp

Pfizer's #COVID19 vaccine can now can be stored at conventional refrigerator temperatures for up to a month, as per Health Canada.

This will allow for greater use in many settings (eg. Family Doctors' office, rural, remote settings etc).

https://t.co/EJuKJXVcWD by @adamsmiller

Excellent news - it looks like Ontario will open up outdoor amenities ahead of schedule, as per the report below.

#COVID19 transmission risk is markedly lower outdoors. https://t.co/YnYQc7MFLB

#COVID19 is significantly under-reported in many low-income countries.

This well conducted Zambian study helps quantify under-reporting & estimates 454,708 true infections from 4917 laboratory-confirmed cases in the six districts sampled.

Link: https://t.co/Xlf0G38pOZ https://t.co/ON6jZwyGdL

There is a need to coordinate acceptable verification of vaccination status.

Mixing #COVID19 vaccines was deemed to be safe & was also associated with a robust immune response in a study out of Spain.

This was a 1st dose of AstraZeneca followed by a 2nd dose of Pfizer. The study enrolled ~700 people (18-60).

Preprint to follow. 

https://t.co/nNu3hh8s6A

A much lower #COVID19 case count today in Ontario (~1600) & general trends headed in the right direction.

While much of this improvement is policy driven, we are probably seeing some effect of the 1st-dose-fast vaccination strategy as well.
